Course and Assignment System o Enables administrators to review and approve course creation requests. o Allows tutors to manage course content and evaluate student assignments. o Supports students in accessing enrolled courses and submitting assignments for evaluation.

Session Coordination o Manages scheduling of live tutoring sessions, dispatches automated reminders, and synchronizes calendars. o Provides virtual classroom functionalities, including video conferencing, whiteboard tools, and screen sharing for interactive lessons. o Initiates and manages payment and refund requests based on session bookings and cancellations. o Performs internal validation of transaction data prior to forwarding requests to external payment gateways.

Analytics and Moderation o Tracks key performance indicators such as attendance records and assignment o Provides administrators with dashboards for monitoring system statistics and moderating user-generated content.
2.2 System module 2.2.1 Login Enables all users to securely access the system using their registered account credentials.
It also supports password recovery by allowing users to request a reset link and update their credentials.
This module receives and displays available courses, provides detailed course information, and allows creation, modification, and deletion of course records.
This module receives and displays user details, supports updating personal information, and manages assigned user roles.
It allows are stored in the database and synchronized across the system to ensure consistency.
Role: Student, Tutor, Administrators 2.2.5 Enrollment Manages the process of course registration for students.
It supports cancellation of enrollments and confirms successful registration.
It enables session recording upon request and securely stores the recordings for future reference or review.
It generates and provides payment invoices to users and validates payment details before approval.
Sensitive payment data is encrypted to ensure compliance with PDPA and PCI DSS requirements, protecting user financial information from unauthorized access.
2.2.10 Search Enables tutor discovery by enabling users to system targeted searches based on course, qualifications, ratings, and availability.
2.3 Design and Implementation Constraints The Online Tutoring System must adhere to several constraints to ensure it is feasible, maintainable, and compliant with industry standards.
2.3.1 Regulatory and Compliance Constraints The platform must comply with legal and ethical requirements, particularly in Malaysia and Southeast Asia:
Accessibility: Follow Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 to ensure usability by individuals with disabilities.
Compatibility: Ensure compatibility with various devices, operating systems, and web browsers.
Scalability: Design the system to handle increasing users and sessions without compromising performance.
Human Resources: Availability of skilled developers, designers, and support staff may limit development pace and scope.
User Interface (UI) Design: Provide an intuitive and user-friendly interface for users with varying technical expertise.
Ensure clear navigation, responsive design, and accessible Localization: Support multiple languages and regional settings to cater to a global user base.
Data Security: Encrypt all user data in transit and at rest to protect against unauthorized access.
Consistency and Responsiveness: Ensure a cohesive look and feel across the platform with a fully responsive design for desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
Scalability and Performance: Design the interface to support future expansion and optimize for fast loading times and smooth interactions, especially during live sessions.
Compliance and Regulations: Platform will comply with current regulations in Malaysia and Southeast Asia.
Resource Availability: Financial, human, and technical resources will be available throughout the project.
Third-Party Services: Third-party services (cloud hosting, payment gateways) will be reliable and uphold SLAs.

The system shall allow new users (students and tutors) to register by providing necessary details like name, email, password, and role.
The system shall send a verification email to confirm the user's email address before account activation.
The system shall allow users to log in using their registered email and password.
The system shall provide a mechanism for users to recover their password via email.
The system shall allow users to view other users' profiles with appropriate privacy controls.
The system shall provide a search function for students to find tutors based on subjects, availability, and ratings.
The system shall allow users to filter and sort tutor search results by price, rating, and experience.
The system shall allow tutors to set their available time slots.
The system shall allow students to book sessions with tutors based on their availability.

As a student, I want to create an account with my name, email, and password so that I can access the system.

As a user, I want to log in with my email and password so that I can access my dashboard.
As a user, I want to reset my password via email so that I can regain access if I forget it.
As a student, I want to update my profile with subjects of interest so that tutors can better match my needs.
As a tutor, I want to update my profile with subjects of expertise so that students can find me easily.
As a user, I want to view other users' profiles with privacy controls so that my personal details remain protected.
As a student, I want to search tutors by subject and availability so that I can find the result I want.

2.2.1 Login Enables all users to securely access the system using their registered account credentials.
The module manages session initiation and termination, ensuring that users are properly authenticated before accessing other system functions.
It also supports password recovery by allowing users to request a reset link and update their credentials.
2.2.2 Registration Handles the creation of new user accounts and validates them through an email verification process.
2.2.3 Course Management Manages the complete lifecycle of course data within the system.
This module receives and displays available courses, provides detailed course information, and allows creation, modification, and deletion of course records.
2.2.4 Profile Management Handles user profile data for students and tutors.
This module receives and displays user details, supports updating personal information, and manages assigned user roles.
It allows are stored in the database and synchronized across the system to ensure consistency.
2.2.5 Enrollment Manages the process of course registration for students.
It supports cancellation of enrollments and confirms successful registration.
It enables session recording upon request and securely stores the recordings for future reference or review.
2.2.7 Payment Manages all financial transactions within the system.
This module handles payment creation, confirmation, and processing of refunds.
It generates and provides payment invoices to users and validates payment details before approval.
Sensitive payment data is encrypted to ensure compliance with PDPA and PCI DSS requirements, protecting user financial information from unauthorized access.
2.2.8 Feedback Collects and manages student evaluations of courses and tutors.
This module enables the creation of chat rooms, exchange of real-time messages, retrieval of previous conversation history, and assignment of support agents to handle inquiries.
2.2.10 Search Enables tutor discovery by enabling users to system targeted searches based on course, qualifications, ratings, and availability.
2.2.11 Notification Manages notification delivery and reminder scheduling for system events.
2.3 Design and Implementation Constraints The Online Tutoring System must adhere to several constraints to ensure it is feasible, maintainable, and compliant with industry standards.
2.3.1 Regulatory and Compliance Constraints The platform must comply with legal and ethical requirements, particularly in Malaysia and Southeast Asia:
2.1 to ensure usability by individuals with disabilities.
Compatibility: Ensure compatibility with various devices, operating systems, and web browsers.
Scalability: Design the system to handle increasing users and sessions without compromising performance.
Human Resources: Availability of skilled developers, designers, and support staff may limit development pace and scope.
User Interface (UI) Design: Provide an intuitive and user-friendly interface for users with varying technical expertise.
Ensure clear navigation, responsive design, and accessible Localization: Support multiple languages and regional settings to cater to a global user base.
Authentication and Authorization: Implement robust authentication mechanisms, such as multi-factor authentication (MFA), and use role-based access control (RBAC) to manage permissions.
Data Security: Encrypt all user data in transit and at rest to protect against unauthorized access.
Consistency and Responsiveness: Ensure a cohesive look and feel across the platform with a fully responsive design for desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
Scalability and Performance: Design the interface to support future expansion and optimize for fast loading times and smooth interactions, especially during live sessions.
Compliance and Regulations: Platform will comply with current regulations in Malaysia and Southeast Asia.
Resource Availability: Financial, human, and technical resources will be available throughout the project.
Third-Party Services: Third-party services (cloud hosting, payment gateways) will be reliable and uphold SLAs.

Meeting Conflicts A strong conflict occurs when no data can be found within the date range and outside all exclusion A weak date conflict occurs when dates can be found within the date range and outside all exclusion sets, but no date can be found at the intersection of all preference sets.

Meeting Conflict Resolution If a conflict occurs while generating a meeting, the system shall notify the initiator and ask to o Notify a participant to remove a date from his exclusive set, o Propose a participant with low importance level to withdraw from the meeting, o Propose a participant to extend his preference set. o Propose the initiator to cancel the meeting.
If none of the proposed locations can meet the equipment requirements while making a meeting schedule, the system should inform the initiator.
The initiator can propose other locations and start the scheduling process again or cancel the meeting and inform all of the participants about that.

SDMSTM Synergy Distributed Meeting Scheduler System Functional Requirements Description The system shall monitor meetings especially when they are held in a distributed manner like when the participants are located at different location and communicate to each other through virtual networks.

When planning meetings, the system shall take into account all constraints that are expressed by the meeting participants Each date that the meeting participant can attend shall be added to the preference set Each date that the meeting participant cannot attend shall be added to the exclusion set If a user changes their constraints, the SDMS shall rearrange the meeting to accommodate this The user s preference set, exclusion set, and preferred location shall be changed before a meeting date/location is proposed by the meeting initiator.
All interactions between the meeting participants will be managed.
The process of negotiation will also be managed.
Moreover the reliability of communication will be monitored.
The user should be able to operate on the functionality easily.
- The system should be able to handle explicit priorities among dates in preference sets.
It should handle explicit dependencies between meeting date and meeting location.
Therefore, any authorized user should be able to request a meeting independently of his/her whereabouts CUSTOMIZABLE::-

- The system shall be customizable to two ways(1) Private (2) Professional meetings these are characterized by different restrictions on the time period that may be allocated (e.g. meeting during office hours, private activities during leisure FLEXIBLE: -

Also, the system should be flexible enough to accommodate evolving data (e.g. the sets of concerned participants may be varying; the address at which a participant can be reached may be varying, etc.).
